item.title: Behind the Mic: My journey to delivering a conference talk
item.description:
I recently gave a talk with Tittu Varghese on “Questioning database claims: Design patterns of storage engines” at GopherConIndia24 on 2nd December. The idea of the talk was to understand various patterns of storage engines (/key-value storage engines) such as:

  • Persistence (WAL, fsync)
  • Efficient Retrieval (B+tree, bloom filters, data layouts)
  • Efficient Ingestion (Sequential IO, LSM, Wisckey)

and then question a variety of database claims like durability, read optimization, write optimization and pick the right database(s) for our use case.
